title: Given mechanism for NO2 - which statement is true

content.prompt:
2 NO(g) + O2(g)  → 2 NO2(g)

Consider the following mechanism for the reaction represented above.

Step 1: 2 NO   ⇄  N2O2              (fast reversible)

Step 2: N2O2 + O2   →   2 NO2         (slow)

Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: Increasing the concentration of NO will decrease the overall rate of the reaction.
Raising the temperature will have no effect on the numerical value of the rate constant.
The rate law that is consistent with the mechanism is rate = k[NO]2[O2].

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
